frameDefinitions: The Reader attends to a Text to process its information.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
An Item becomes filled with a Substance as a result of movement of liquid into visible or invisible interstices in the Item.

A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
A Reader visually examines a Text, typically in a linear order, to understand its content.
frameExamples: I <t>read</t> A Tale of Two Cities last night.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
<t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
Paper and board <t>absorb</t> moisture in the winter.
The fraud was <t>extradited</t> from Venezuela to the US.
listRoleDefinitions: The one who examines a Text to understand it.
The entity that contains linguistic symbols.
When the reading event takes place.
Where the reading event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.

The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.
The <fen>Item</fen> is the absorbant friendly thing that takes in the <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the material that is taken in by the <fen>Item</fen>.
When the <fen>Item</fen> takes in <fen>Substance</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Item</fen> takes in <fen>Substance</fen>.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> act on behalf of the <fen>Current_jurisdiction</fen>, giving up the <fen>Suspect</fen> to the Crime_jurisdiction.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the <fen>Suspect</fen> starts off in.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is sent.
The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.
The time at which  the <fen>Suspect</fen> is moved.
The location where the extradition occurs.
The one who examines a <fen>Text</fen> to understand it.
The entity that contains linguistic symbols.
The idea that an implicit <fen>Text</fen> or texts focuses on.
When the reading event takes place.
Where the reading event takes place.
listRoleExamples: Charlie often reads the newspaper <fex>at night</fex>.
Surprisingly, few of the students read much at all <fex>in the designated reading rooms</fex>.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
<fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
<fex>French officials</fex> extradited him back to Canada.
Jones was extradited <fex>from Mexico</fex> last Thursday to face criminal charges in the United States.
It was the third time a neo-Nazi was extradited from Denmark <fex>to Germany</fex>.
A hearing on whether or not to extradite <fex>Johnson</fex> to Isreal will be held tomorrow.
<fex>In Europe</fex> they extradite more freely than in North America.
Charlie often reads the newspaper <fex>at night</fex>.
Surprisingly, few of the students read much at all <fex>in the designated reading rooms</fex>.
